bcl:definition.bcl:text: Act means the Natural Products Marketing (BC) Act;
commercial producer means a person who operates a farm

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: from which the person markets, or
on which there are hog production facilities capable of producing for market

bcl:definition.bcl:text: 300 or more hogs annually, for processing;
commission means the British Columbia Hog Marketing Commission referred to in section 4;
hog means a pig of any age;
producer means a person who operates a farm from which the person markets one or more hogs annually for processing;
registered producer means a commercial producer whose name has been entered and remains registered in the register referred to in section 7 as a commercial producer;
regulated product means hogs grown in the Province for processing.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: A scheme called the British Columbia Hog Marketing Scheme is established in the terms of this regulation.
The objects of the scheme are

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to initiate, support or conduct programs for promoting, stimulating, increasing and improving the economic well-being of persons engaged in the production, processing and marketing of the regulated product, and
to initiate and carry out programs for regulating, promoting, stimulating, increasing and improving the marketing of the regulated product.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The scheme applies to persons who produce, transport, pack, store or market the regulated product, and to all grades and classes of the regulated product.
A commission called the British Columbia Hog Marketing Commission is established to administer the scheme under the supervision of the British Columbia Farm Industry Review Board.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a chair appointed by the Lieutenant Governor in Council, and
up to 5 members who are registered producers, elected by the registered producers.
the member serving as chair when this regulation comes into force continues to hold that office until the Lieutenant Governor in Council makes an appointment under subsection (2) (a), and

the members serving on the commission when this regulation comes into force continue to hold their offices until elections are held under approved rules and procedures for elections established under subsection (4).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The commission must establish and publish rules and procedures for the election of commission members.
The British Columbia Farm Industry Review Board must approve the rules and procedures referred to in subsection (4) before those rules take effect.
The commission is vested with the power in the Province to promote, control and regulate in any respect the marketing of the regulated product.
Without restricting the generality of subsection (1), the commission is vested with

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the powers set out in section 11 (1) (e) to (j), (o) (i), (ii), (iv) and (v), (p), (q) and (v) of the Act, and

the powers to regulate the time and place at which a regulated product must be transported or marketed, and to determine the manner of distribution, the quantity and quality, and the grade or class of the regulated product that must be transported or marketed.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Approval is given for the commission to exercise an authority or function conferred on it by or under a federal Act or by a federal board.

Where a commercial producer applies to be registered as a commercial producer, and the commission is satisfied that the commercial producer qualifies under section 8, it shall enter the commercial producer's name and address in the register as a commercial producer.

Where the commission is satisfied that a person has ceased to qualify as a commercial producer, it shall amend the register to reflect that fact, but unless the person affected requests the amendment the commission shall first mail a notice by registered post to the person at the person's last registered address advising the person of the proposed amendment.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: is in arrears of the commercial producer's licence fees, or
fails to comply with a provision of the scheme or an order from the commission,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the commission may strike the commercial producer's name from the register.

bcl:section.bcl:text: A person qualifies to be registered as a commercial producer if the person operates a farm

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: from which the person markets, or
on which there are hog production facilities capable of producing for market

bcl:section.bcl:text: 300 or more hogs annually, for processing.
